trans-unit.source: Desired State Configuration (DSC) Known Issues and Limitations
trans-unit.target: Desired State Configuration (DSC) Known Issues and Limitations

trans-unit.source: Breaking Change: Certificates used to encrypt/decrypt passwords in DSC configurations may not work after installing WMF 5.0 RTM
trans-unit.target: Breaking Change: Certificates used to encrypt/decrypt passwords in DSC configurations may not work after installing WMF 5.0 RTM

trans-unit.source: In WMF 4.0 and WMF 5.0 Preview releases, DSC would not allow passwords in the configuration to be of length more than 121 characters.
trans-unit.target: In WMF 4.0 and WMF 5.0 Preview releases, DSC would not allow passwords in the configuration to be of length more than 121 characters.

trans-unit.source: DSC was forcing to use short passwords even if lengthy and strong password was desired.
trans-unit.target: DSC was forcing to use short passwords even if lengthy and strong password was desired.

trans-unit.source: This breaking change allows passwords to be of arbitrary length in the DSC configuration.
trans-unit.target: This breaking change allows passwords to be of arbitrary length in the DSC configuration.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Re-create the certificate with Data Encipherment or Key Encipherment Key usage, and Document Encryption Enhanced Key usage (1.3.6.1.4.1.311.80.1).
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Re-create the certificate with Data Encipherment or Key Encipherment Key usage, and Document Encryption Enhanced Key usage (1.3.6.1.4.1.311.80.1).

trans-unit.source: Technet article <https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn807171.aspx> has more information.
trans-unit.target: Technet article <https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn807171.aspx> has more information.

trans-unit.source: DSC cmdlets may fail after installing WMF 5.0 RTM
trans-unit.target: DSC cmdlets may fail after installing WMF 5.0 RTM

trans-unit.source: Start-DscConfiguration and other DSC cmdlets may fail after installing WMF 5.0 RTM with the following error:
trans-unit.target: Start-DscConfiguration and other DSC cmdlets may fail after installing WMF 5.0 RTM with the following error:

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Delete DSCEngineCache.mof by running the following command in an elevated PowerShell session (Run as Administrator):
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Delete DSCEngineCache.mof by running the following command in an elevated PowerShell session (Run as Administrator):

trans-unit.source: DSC cmdlets may not work if WMF 5.0 RTM is installed on top of WMF 5.0 Production Preview
trans-unit.target: DSC cmdlets may not work if WMF 5.0 RTM is installed on top of WMF 5.0 Production Preview

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Run the following command in an elevated PowerShell session (run as administrator):
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Run the following command in an elevated PowerShell session (run as administrator):

trans-unit.source: LCM can go into an unstable state while using Get-DscConfiguration in DebugMode
trans-unit.target: LCM can go into an unstable state while using Get-DscConfiguration in DebugMode

trans-unit.source: If LCM is in DebugMode, pressing CTRL+C to stop the processing of Get-DscConfiguration can cause LCM to go into an unstable state such that majority of DSC cmdlets won’t work.
trans-unit.target: If LCM is in DebugMode, pressing CTRL+C to stop the processing of Get-DscConfiguration can cause LCM to go into an unstable state such that majority of DSC cmdlets won’t work.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Don’t press CTRL+C while debugging Get-DscConfiguration cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Don’t press CTRL+C while debugging Get-DscConfiguration cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Stop-DscConfiguration may hang in DebugMode
trans-unit.target: Stop-DscConfiguration may hang in DebugMode

trans-unit.source: If LCM is in DebugMode, Stop-DscConfiguration may hang while trying to stop an operation started by Get-DscConfiguration
trans-unit.target: If LCM is in DebugMode, Stop-DscConfiguration may hang while trying to stop an operation started by Get-DscConfiguration

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Finish the debugging of the operation started by Get-DscConfiguration as outlined in section ‘[DSC RESOURCE SCRIPT DEBUGGING](#dsc-resource-script-debugging)’.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Finish the debugging of the operation started by Get-DscConfiguration as outlined in section ‘[DSC RESOURCE SCRIPT DEBUGGING](#dsc-resource-script-debugging)’.

trans-unit.source: No Verbose Error Messages are shown in DebugMode
trans-unit.target: No Verbose Error Messages are shown in DebugMode

trans-unit.source: If LCM is in DebugMode, no verbose error messages are displayed from DSC Resources.
trans-unit.target: If LCM is in DebugMode, no verbose error messages are displayed from DSC Resources.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Disable *DebugMode* to see verbose messages from the resource
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Disable *DebugMode* to see verbose messages from the resource

trans-unit.source: Invoke-DscResource operations cannot be retrieved by Get-DscConfigurationStatus cmdlet
trans-unit.target: Invoke-DscResource operations cannot be retrieved by Get-DscConfigurationStatus cmdlet

trans-unit.source: After using Invoke-DscResource cmdlet to directly invoke any resource’s methods, the records of such operation cannot be retrieved through Get-DscConfigurationStatus at a later time.
trans-unit.target: After using Invoke-DscResource cmdlet to directly invoke any resource’s methods, the records of such operation cannot be retrieved through Get-DscConfigurationStatus at a later time.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** None.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** None.

trans-unit.source: Get-DscConfigurationStatus returns pull cycle operations as type *Consistency*
trans-unit.target: Get-DscConfigurationStatus returns pull cycle operations as type *Consistency*

trans-unit.source: When a node is set to PULL refresh mode, for each pull operation performed, Get-DscConfigurationStatus cmdlet reports the operation type as *Consistency* instead of *Initial*
trans-unit.target: When a node is set to PULL refresh mode, for each pull operation performed, Get-DscConfigurationStatus cmdlet reports the operation type as *Consistency* instead of *Initial*

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** None.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** None.

trans-unit.source: Invoke-DscResource cmdlet does not return message in the order they were produced
trans-unit.target: Invoke-DscResource cmdlet does not return message in the order they were produced

trans-unit.source: The Invoke-DscResource cmdlet does not return verbose, warning, and error messages in the order they were produced by LCM or the DSC resource.
trans-unit.target: The Invoke-DscResource cmdlet does not return verbose, warning, and error messages in the order they were produced by LCM or the DSC resource.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** None.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** None.

trans-unit.source: DSC Resources cannot be debugged easily when used with Invoke-DscResource
trans-unit.target: DSC Resources cannot be debugged easily when used with Invoke-DscResource

trans-unit.source: When LCM is running in debug mode (see [DSC RESOURCE SCRIPT DEBUGGING](#dsc-resource-script-debugging) for more details), Invoke-DscResource cmdlet does not give information about runspace to connect to for debugging.
trans-unit.target: When LCM is running in debug mode (see [DSC RESOURCE SCRIPT DEBUGGING](#dsc-resource-script-debugging) for more details), Invoke-DscResource cmdlet does not give information about runspace to connect to for debugging.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Discover and attach to the runspace using cmdlets **Get-PSHostProcessInfo**, **Enter-PSHostProcess** , **Get-Runspace** and **Debug-Runspace** to debug the DSC resource.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Discover and attach to the runspace using cmdlets **Get-PSHostProcessInfo**, **Enter-PSHostProcess** , **Get-Runspace** and **Debug-Runspace** to debug the DSC resource.

trans-unit.source: Various Partial Configuration documents for same node cannot have identical resource names
trans-unit.target: Various Partial Configuration documents for same node cannot have identical resource names

trans-unit.source: For several partial configurations that are deployed onto a single node, identical names of resources cause run time error.
trans-unit.target: For several partial configurations that are deployed onto a single node, identical names of resources cause run time error.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Use different names for even same resources in different partial configurations.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Use different names for even same resources in different partial configurations.

trans-unit.source: Start-DscConfiguration –UseExisting does not work with -Credential
trans-unit.target: Start-DscConfiguration –UseExisting does not work with -Credential

trans-unit.source: When using Start-DscConfiguration with –UseExisting parameter, the –Credential parameter is ignored.
trans-unit.target: When using Start-DscConfiguration with –UseExisting parameter, the –Credential parameter is ignored.

trans-unit.source: DSC uses default process identity to proceed the operation.
trans-unit.target: DSC uses default process identity to proceed the operation.

trans-unit.source: This causes error when a different credential is needed to proceed on remote node.
trans-unit.target: This causes error when a different credential is needed to proceed on remote node.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Use CIM session for remote DSC operations:
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Use CIM session for remote DSC operations:

trans-unit.source: IPv6 Addresses as Node Names in DSC configurations
trans-unit.target: IPv6 Addresses as Node Names in DSC configurations

trans-unit.source: IPv6 addresses as node names in DSC configuration scripts are not supported in this release.
trans-unit.target: IPv6 addresses as node names in DSC configuration scripts are not supported in this release.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** None.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** None.

trans-unit.source: Debugging of Class-Based DSC Resources
trans-unit.target: Debugging of Class-Based DSC Resources

trans-unit.source: Debugging of class-based DSC Resources is not supported in this release.
trans-unit.target: Debugging of class-based DSC Resources is not supported in this release.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** None.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** None.

trans-unit.source: Variables & Functions defined in $script scope in DSC Class-Based Resource are not preserved across multiple calls to a DSC Resource
trans-unit.target: Variables & Functions defined in $script scope in DSC Class-Based Resource are not preserved across multiple calls to a DSC Resource

trans-unit.source: Multiple consecutive calls to Start-DSCConfiguration will fail if configuration is using any class-based resource which has variables or functions defined in $script scope.
trans-unit.target: Multiple consecutive calls to Start-DSCConfiguration will fail if configuration is using any class-based resource which has variables or functions defined in $script scope.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Define all variables and functions in DSC Resource class itself.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Define all variables and functions in DSC Resource class itself.

trans-unit.source: No $script scope variables/functions.
trans-unit.target: No $script scope variables/functions.

trans-unit.source: DSC Resource Debugging when a resource is using PSDscRunAsCredential
trans-unit.target: DSC Resource Debugging when a resource is using PSDscRunAsCredential

trans-unit.source: DSC Resource debugging when a resource is using the *PSDscRunAsCredential* property in the configuration is not suported in this release.
trans-unit.target: DSC Resource debugging when a resource is using the *PSDscRunAsCredential* property in the configuration is not suported in this release.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** None.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** None.

trans-unit.source: PsDscRunAsCredential is not supported for DSC Composite Resources
trans-unit.target: PsDscRunAsCredential is not supported for DSC Composite Resources

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Use Credential property if available.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Use Credential property if available.

trans-unit.source: Example ServiceSet and WindowsFeatureSet
trans-unit.target: Example ServiceSet and WindowsFeatureSet

trans-unit.source: *Get-DscResource -Syntax* does not reflect PsDscRunAsCredential correctly
trans-unit.target: *Get-DscResource -Syntax* does not reflect PsDscRunAsCredential correctly

trans-unit.source: Get-DscResource -Syntax does not reflect PsDscRunAsCredential correctly when resource marks it as mandatory or does not support it.
trans-unit.target: Get-DscResource -Syntax does not reflect PsDscRunAsCredential correctly when resource marks it as mandatory or does not support it.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** None.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** None.

trans-unit.source: However, authoring configuration in ISE reflects correct metadata about PsDscRunAsCredential property when using IntelliSense.
trans-unit.target: However, authoring configuration in ISE reflects correct metadata about PsDscRunAsCredential property when using IntelliSense.

trans-unit.source: WindowsOptionalFeature is not available in Windows 7
trans-unit.target: WindowsOptionalFeature is not available in Windows 7

trans-unit.source: The WindowsOptionalFeature DSC resource is not available in Windows 7.
trans-unit.target: The WindowsOptionalFeature DSC resource is not available in Windows 7.

trans-unit.source: This resource requires the DISM module, and DISM cmdlets that are available starting in Windows 8 and newer releases of the Windows operating system.
trans-unit.target: This resource requires the DISM module, and DISM cmdlets that are available starting in Windows 8 and newer releases of the Windows operating system.

trans-unit.source: For Class-based DSC resources, Import-DscResource -ModuleVersion may not work as expected
trans-unit.target: For Class-based DSC resources, Import-DscResource -ModuleVersion may not work as expected

trans-unit.source: If the compilation node has multiple version of a class-based DSC resource module, `Import-DscResource -ModuleVersion` does not pick the specified version and results in following compilation error.
trans-unit.target: If the compilation node has multiple version of a class-based DSC resource module, `Import-DscResource -ModuleVersion` does not pick the specified version and results in following compilation error.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Import the required version by defining the *ModuleSpecification* object to the `-ModuleName` with `RequiredVersion` key specified as follows:
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Import the required version by defining the *ModuleSpecification* object to the `-ModuleName` with `RequiredVersion` key specified as follows:

trans-unit.source: Some DSC resources like registry resource may start to take a long time to process the request.
trans-unit.target: Some DSC resources like registry resource may start to take a long time to process the request.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution1:** Create a schedule task that cleans up the following folder periodically.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution1:** Create a schedule task that cleans up the following folder periodically.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution2:** Change the DSC configuration to clean up the *CommandAnalysis* folder at the end of the configuration.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution2:** Change the DSC configuration to clean up the *CommandAnalysis* folder at the end of the configuration.
